snippet: Anthony D. Weiner, who resigned from Congress in 2011, appears to be having difficulty recruiting veteran political aides.
abstract: Anthony D Weiner appears to be having difficulty recruiting veteran political aides for possible bid for New York City mayor; Weiner faces obstacles, with late entry into race, reputation as temperamental boss, and scandal over salacious messages he sent to women online that forced him to resign from Congress in 2011.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

lead_paragraph: Anthony D. Weiner, who resigned from Congress in 2011, appears to be having difficulty recruiting veteran political aides.

headline.seo: Weiner Said to Hire Relative Unknown to Run Mayoral Campaign
headline.main: Weighing Bid for City Hall, Weiner Is Said to Be Struggling to Fill Out His Team
headline.print_headline: Weighing Bid for City Hall, Weiner Is Said to Be Struggling to Fill Out His Team
